title: For Sale:  Remington -- Rem 700 in 7-08 on custom Serengeti Rifle Stock
postcontent: Stunning piece of English Walnut I received when Serengeti Rifles Inc closed and sold to Kilimanjaro Rifles Inc. This is a 5-layer laminated stock utilizing the patented Acrabond method, now known as Stealth Lamination. This means you retain the beauty of the wood without the warping effects found in solid wood stocks. This is a mountain-rifle style, slim stock with an open grip. It is English walnut. The Serengeti pattern here is called a Cheetah geometry. Schnabel forend tip, Ebony Grip. LOP is 13.5" with this slim butt pad. Deluxe Checkering, 22LPI by Charlie Kuter now (deceased). Slim line cheekpiece. Includes a Bausch & Lomb Elite 3000 3 x 9 Scope. The barreled action is stock, off a Rem 700. The barrel extends just over 8" from the schnabel tip. It is not serekoted. The bolt knob does have the very handy checkering for extra grip. The true value here is the Serengeti Stock worth over $2500 itself. I paid $600 JUST for the barreled action, excluding scope! This rifle was shot on one hundred and two hundred yard ranges and produced within a half MOA on factory loads. This is offered at this price to SELL. A super fun and lightweight rifle! I will accept paypal or check. You have 3 days maximum to review and return (return shipping at your own expense). Pls note-the wood to metal fit is not superior like it would have been had Serengeti fit it. But at this price, do it yourself and save THOUSANDS. Email me with any questions.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Early Model Mossberg .22
postcontent:
I have a mossberg model 342ka that I just got in a trade and was considering restoring. I'm just putting this out as a feeler to see what else is out there. It is a magazine fed bolt action gun with a 10 round detachable magazine. It has an 18 inch barrel and a wood monte carlo style stock. It is missing the flip down forend and it was in my restoration plans to replace it, although should you want the gun without it that would be fine as well. The only other major issue is that the plastic buttplate is cracked in half but again that can be found and replaced easily. Otherwise I was just going to touch up the bluing with some cold blue and refinish the stock. The gun shoots 100% as is right now but is a little sore on the eyes. I would be interested in other .22s or a .22mag. Other old Mossbergs would be great as well, i'd love to tinker with a semi auto.

title: For Sale:  New Reality Series Seeks Gun Enthusiasts with RARE guns!
location: Fort Bragg Area, Fayetteville, North Carolina
postcontent:
A new gun show series that's filming in Fayetteville, NC is currently looking for gun enthusiasts and experts that would like to showcase their RARE firearm.

We are looking to feature big, interesting antique, exotic, or high-end guns on the show. Potential sellers would negotiate a deal with the owner of the shop and then test out their gun at the store's firing range. 

Here's a little more info : 

This is a new reality show revolving around the locally owned and run Guns Plus located in Spring Lake, NC on Bragg Boulevard. The show documents people and their possessions as they enter Guns Plus looking to make a deal and test out the guns at the store's shooting range. The shop buys and sells all sorts of weaponry including exotic high end and antique guns (like current popular pawn TV shows but taken up a notch!). 

We are looking to shoot the week of April 15th, so there is a tight deadline. If interesting please email GunShowTVCasting @ Gmail.com with the following:

- Your name and basic contact info
- What type of gun you have and a few sentences about it: How you got it, how long you've had it, why is it rare, what type is it, etc. 
- A few pictures of you and of your firearms

Again, please email GunShowTVCasting @ Gmail.com for more info.

title: For Sale:  JC Higgins Model 50
postcontent:
This is an early 1950s rifle sold by Sears Roebuck, and it is essentially a Hi-Standard chrome-lined barrel on an FNH, Belgian-made Mauser action chambered in .30-06. If not for the JC Higgins name, these rifles would sell for much, much more as it is a high quality and very accurate rifle. 

I personally have fired 45 rounds. No idea of the previous round count over the past 60 years, but the rifle is in great shape with a shiny bore and good rifling. .30-06 is expensive for frequent target practice, and I do not hunt, so I really have no reason to justify keeping this rifle as I hate keeping guns I rarely shoot when someone else may get more use out of it. 

The rifle and stock are in great shape. The only flaws are some minor wear of the bluing, especially near the muzzle, and a previous owner attached a Kick EEZ recoil pad that is about the correct width but a 1/4 inch or so short in length (there is a gap between the pad’s toe and the toe of the stock). No idea as to where the original pad is. 

The scope is a like-new Meike 6.5-24x40mm with a very clear sight picture (I am the first owner and purchased it for $200 only a couple months ago). From my research I have gleaned that the company is in Hong Kong, and they make amazing optics for very low prices. The scope has lockable turret adjustment knobs, 6.5x-24x zoom, a yardage interval focus knob, and a battery powered, adjustable brightness, red/blue reticle illuminator. I have Weaver quick-detach 30mm scope rings mounted on Weaver Mauser scope bases.

To round everything out I am including:
1 - Blackhawk cheek rest with pouch and 5 cartridge loops 
1 - Blackhawk .308 MOLLE pouch holding 20. rds, coyote tan 
1 - leather sling
1 - bore snake 
15 rds. HSM 180 gr 
45 spent casings for you reloaders (20 Nosler Custom, 5 HSM & 20 Federal)

No individual sale of items.

Face to Face in Fort Collins ONLY. 

I require a valid CO driver’s license and a signed bill of sale.
Cash only & no trades will be entertained

postcontent:
Semi-automatic Romanian "G" AK-47 equipped with an ATF approved Slide Fire Solutions SSAK-47 bump fire stock which allows for effortless simulated full-auto fire. (If you haven't heard of one, check out the link below and watch the demo video)

www.atlanticfirearms.com/storeproduct1064.aspx

I bought this gun a few weeks ago from a private party, but now I have my sights set on another gun, so up for sale it goes.

Technical Specs:

- Romanian G AK-47 built on a US made NoDak Spud receiver
- Tapco G2 double hook fire control group
- Steel 30 rnd mag with Arsenal US made follower
- Tapco slant muzzle brake
- UTG tactical quad rail 
- CAA short vertical foregrip
- Black nylon padded 2 point tactical sling
- Slide Fire Solutions SSAK-47 bump fire stock

Also includes a set of beautiful Russian Red wood furniture and bakelite grip with standard mounting hardware. The wood furniture is foreign made, but the gun is configured such that as long as you use US made magazines or the included steel mag that I added a US made follower to, you can put the foreign made furniture on and still be 922r compliant. If you don't know what 922r is and don't know what I'm talking about, it is worth running a google search. I also have an original Romy G furniture set with the black stripe buttstock and the wooden "Donkey dong" foregrip that everybody likes to cut off. I'll throw it in too if I can find it.

Price is $850 firm, face to face transaction in Enumclaw (willing to drive to Puyallup or Auburn but that's about it). I will need to see your WA state drivers license just so I know you are a legal resident. I won't be writing anything down, I just want to take a peek. 

Anticipating possible objections by those accustomed to $400 - $500 AKs, and to save the same the trouble of sending me an email with a lowball offer, my asking price reflects the fact that the slide fire stock is a nearly $300 stock and a Romy G is a quality AK, not the typical cheapo WASR-10 Century guns. Even without the Slide Fire stock, we are talking a $650 - $750 gun. Not all AKs are the same. $850 is a heck of a deal for this set up. 

If you dont want the tacticsl configuration, I am willing to sell the gun with just the wood furniture for $650 without the SSAK stock and quad rail.

title: For Sale:  (2) Brand New Hatchets/Spirit Pipes - Historically correct reproductions.
location: Tallmadge by Chapel Hill Mall, Cleveland, Ohio
postcontent:
I have (2) brand new, beautiful Spirit Pipes. They are hatchets on one end and a peace pipe on the other. These are historically correct items meaning they were actually used by Native Americans like this. After Indians started buying the sturdier European/American style hatchets made by a blacksmith instead of fastening a sharpened stone to a "handle" they would drill a hole down the middle so they could have a ceremonial pipe and a weapon. I like the whole "War and Peace" aspect of these hatchets. They are well done reproductions and well made.

The Hatchet with the Feather attached is $60 and the other one is $75. Make me an offer the worst I can do is say no.

title: For Sale:  Catello Tribuzio 1889 Palm Squeeze Pistol -Rare!
postcontent: This posting is for what I believe to be is a very unique and by all accounts very rare, Catello Tribuzio Palm Pistol. All information I found dates it to around the 1880's to 1890's. One account states that Tribuzio received the patent in 1899 for this self-loading pistol and I heard it referred to as the 1899 Tribuzio Palm Pistol. This particular gun does not have any visible markings and I am not sure if that means this was a prototype or maybe it wore off over the years. From doing some quick research myself, it appears this one is missing the side extractor bars and possibly a pin close to where the ring-trigger closes. I could not find any other obvious missing components, but I am also not familiar with this model. The barrel is nicely threaded into the frame and the firing mechanism is removable as well. The long pin protruding from the rear is spring loaded and goes all the way through to become the firing pin. I did a quick check and it looks like the caliber would be equivalent to modern 25acp. The ring-like trigger seems to function properly and it closes the bolt upon squeezing. The safety lever on the side rotates around to allow the side plate to be removed, but I am not sure how the safety itself is supposed to function. I will post a lot of detailed pictures later today and certainly do not hesitate to ask any questions. This is definitely outside of my field of expertise, but I have consulted with some of the industry experts during my research of this unique firearm.  Additional pictures available.

postcontent: I have found very little info on this rifle. I have never found another like it, so if you can enlighten me on it or correct something about it please let me know. It is a real beauty especially since i guess it is 123 years old!! In fact it is so pretty for its age i would have to say that the blueing and stock have been redone exceptionally well. I have shot some Turkish nickel 8mm Mauser ammo through it as well as Sellier & Bellot 196 grain 8x57js ammo. Functions perfect and has a nice smooth action and nice feel overall. There is some question whether the Sellier & Bellot ammo is safe to shoot through this due to the js designation, so i would recommend having a competent gunsmith check this for you, but both fired fine for me. It is a very powerful rifle! To much rifle for me and what i need! It has a redfield peepsight on the rear with a blade sight on the front. It has a brand new handmade custom leather sling that goes with it along with about 15 rounds of the turkish ammo in a bandolier and about 40 rounds of the Sellier & Bellot along with some empty casings and stripper clips, which will have to ship seperately. What I think I know is that it is the first rifle produced by FN. It says Fabrique Nationale and below that faintly is -liege I cannot really make out the Herstal part that is suppose to be before the -Liege, but i believe this puts it made in belgium. It has a 5 round detachable magazine and a pachmayr butt pad. It does not appear to have any matching numbers. It has 8mm stamped on the barrel. It has various markings on it including the FN crown. It has approximately a 23-1/2" barrel. I would rate the metal at 90% or better and the wood at about the same. The only real places that the blue is wearing is on the bottom of the bolt handle and bolt itself. When i got this rifle the bore looked perfect to me, but since shooting about 40 rounds through it it doesn't seem to look that great. I have cleaned the heck out of it, but still seems to have powder in the rifling, I will try to clean it again before sold. The rifling is strong but i guess i would rate the bore at 80%? U.S.P.S. postal money order only! Flat shipping rate of $30.00 for lower 48 states will include proper packaging, tracking and insurance via UPS the fastest way possible for the money, but will probably be ground. Guarantee it to shoot and be in condition stated! If i were to keep it i would possibly drill and tap it for a scope, but like i said it's to much gun for my needs. It is the only bolt action in the pic of the three guns. Other two shotguns are sold. Thanks!

title: For Sale:  jc higgins model 66 semi auto 12 ga
postcontent: Shotgun works fine and is in fantastic shape. I'm not even sure if it was ever fired before i got it, but it was very dusty. I gave it a thourough cleaning and i just put a couple rounds through it to make sure it functions correctly. It has a vent rib at an overall length of 26" including the compensator and multi-choke which includes cyl., imp.cyl., mod., imp.mod, full and xtra full! The metal i would rate at about 98%!, the beautiful tiger striped wood at about 95% (the pistol grip portion lacquer came off when i cleaned it, but if you oil it it is hardly noticeable)and bore at 95% or higher and still plenty shiny. Original jc higgins butt plate is in great shape along with the pistol grip plate. Gold tone trigger even still looks very good along with the jeweled bolt. These were made by high standard and i have a pdf version of basically the owners manual i can email you to go with it. This must have been a deluxe model and is a beautiful example! title: For Sale/Trade:  Ruger SR9C 9mm Brushed Stainless w/Serpa holster
postcontent:
For sale or trade is like new Ruger SR9C subcompact 9mm. Original box with all the original materials and paperwork. Gun is like brand new. 

It comes with two magazines that provide options in both capacity and grip size. The standard magazine holds 10 rounds and features a flat bottom butt plate; a finger grip extension floor plate is also included. The second magazine features a grip adapter and holds 17 rounds, instantly transforming the smaller, compact grip into a full-sized 9mm grip. Has rail accommodates most lights and lasers.

Crazy accurate and works flawlessly. Less than 75 rds thru it.  Have another one so no need for two.  Be hard pressed to find another one for sale this nice on Armslist.  Comes with Blackhawk Carbon Serpa paddle holster ($45 value)

Must have NC CCW or Sheriff issued pistol permit. Certificates and copies will not get it nor will I sale out of state unless shipped to FFL holder at ur expense. Must also sign bill of sale.

Not into traveling very far so you would need to meet close to Burlington or Greensboro area.
